ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We strengthened our presence and activities in 14 districts, 84 Blocks, 479 Village Panchayats through which we directly impacting the lives of 2816091 people of Tamil Nadu over the past 6 years. The year 2005-2006 was a year of significant changes and introspection for us at Coodu Trust and marks the beginning of a new era. We therefore present this annual report as a summary of our growth over the past few years(since 2000-2009). The Watershed Development Programmes and our activities in creating and supporting women Self Help Groups have been the backbone of our activities in different districts. Our other activities have been in implementing Total sanitation Campaigns, Income Generation Programmes Health programmes, and support to Government agencies on their Research, Training, Information Technology and IEC design & production needs. Coodu Trust has always been supporting the implementation of the Watershed Development Programmes by conducting PRA, mobilizing and organizing the community, Providing training and capacity building to different levels of implementers, appointing the Watershed Development Team members, other technical and managerial support, managing the development works and guiding the activities at the grassroots levels. The Watershed Development Team member employed by Coodu Trust on behalf of the Project Implementing Agencies (PIA) have now been transferred as direct contract employees of the PIAs. We however continue our support to the PIAs in different districts by guiding the watershed development programmes and taking up specific tasks. During this year we are also entering in areas such as Entrepreneurship Development, Marketing Infrastructure and support for Agricultural, Horticultural, Forest and Cottage industry products including the products of Women Self Help Groups and small and marginal producers. We are also establishing Health services such as Counseling centers, Care & Support of People Living with HIV / AIDS and working on ways to reach Health care to the unreached. Our Research and consultancy division is now a full service research agencies providing online research services, large scale survey research, PRA, Qualitative research, Data processing and analysis services. Our Communication center is evolving into a self-sustainable design and production unit providing quality design, development and production services in print, folk media, photography, video and cyber media. Our Training division has now networked trainers and consultants on a range of subjects. We have recently completed training of 35000 members of 2500 Women self help groups. We have also supported the training of care providers of People living with HIV/AIDS. Environment Sanitation training under Total Sanitation Campaign has been provided to panchayal level federation leaders and self help group animator representatives in 2 districts. We are now developing syllabus for training and certification programmes in a number of skill areas where formal training and certification does not exist at present.

The training programme was organised by Coodu trust to the key level functionaries of PLF in Dindigul district for the effective functioning of their PLF Jointly organised with Mahalir thittam ,Dindigul and 102 Plf members were benefitted through this programme

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: C.P.R. Environmental Education Centre (CPREEC) is a Centre of Excellence of the Ministry of Environment and Forests (MoEF) , Government of India, established jointly by the Ministry and the C.P.Ramaswami Aiyar Foundation . The Centre has been a pioneer in environmental education efforts in South India and has conducted a variety of programmes to spread awareness and interest among the masses. Our Mission Statement C.P.R. Environmental Education Centre (CPREEC) strives to increase awareness and knowledge of key target groups (school children, local communities, woman etc.) about the various aspects of environment. We fulfill our mission by: promoting environmental awareness among schools, grass-root level organization and the general public. strengthening capacities of educators and practioners (teachers, local NGOs) in the field on environmental education by providing technical support and educational resources. understanding the major environmental issues facing India today and developing innovative solutions. promoting conservation of nature and its resources by emphasizing on the conservation of ecological traditions of India.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Having been started in 1988 the Crafts council of Tamil Nadu is a registered NGO that aims at progress of Handicrafts by providing facilities and opportunities to craftsmen for their welfare. Over the years the Council has worked with many craftspeople at the grass root level interacting with them personally to understand their needs and to provide them. To name a few of them, the council has worked with Kurumba Kambili to improve the quality of the yarn. The improvement in quality of embroidery done by the lambadis of Dharmapuri is another feather in the cap. We have worked with the craftspeople of Pudhukottai in making Ayannar Statues. We have worked with stone workers to give them design imputs to suit the modern urban clients. Similar work was done in the Jamakalam sector of Bavani. The workshop and book on various flower tying techniques has improved the life of many artisans for whom advanced training by mastercraftsman from Thailanad was arranged. Documentation of various crafts like the leaf Killi of Srivalliputtur and Palani is an example of the committment of the council. The sheet metal designs given to the artisans have made their wares more contemprary. Currently the council is involved in the revival of a few languishing crafts. The Crafts Bazar held anually for over 10 years is a platform for over 150 craftspeople to exhibit and sell their wares. The Council is contantly striving towards improving the design imputs ,techniques and marketablity of crafts products thus lending dignity to the craftsmen and nurturing sustainablity of the craft

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Women Development and Empowerment DAWN Trust has carried out a programme of helping women in the rural area of Perambalur District Tamilnadu in skills development and income generation activities with the assistance of Mahalir Thittam Tamilnadu Social Welfare Board Perambalur. More than two hundred and fifty women have been so far trained in various activities such as Beautician course Lab Technician Training candle making phenol Chalk piece and Camphor making. Created awareness programmes on Legal Aid and Violence against Women. Identified outsatanding women in various feild of Education Health Social work HIV positive women Gypsy Physically challenged women group leaders and provided awards on womens day. Health awareness. Community Action for Health Project under NRHM DAWN Trust has formed twenty Village Health Water Sanitation Nutrition Committee in Perambalur Block. Each committee comprises fifteen to twenty five members. DAWN Trust has given orientation and periodical training to the members of the committee to achieve their health rights on their own. Vellore Panchayat and Ladapuram Panchayat committees solved the problem of darkness of the road near Primary Health Centre. Through their efforts the street lights were provided in the road near PHC. Asbestos sheet roofs were place over the waiting place for the benefit of patients. The TASMAC Wine Shop opposite to Chatramanai Panchayat PHC was nuisance for patients and women. With our initiation the shop was taken away from that place. To control spread of flu and other epidermis diseases necessary steps were taken to chlorinate by mixing of chlorine in the drinking water tanks periodically. Information Boards were installed in fifteen panchayat it gives necessary information regarding health facilities. DAWN has organised two hundred and four GKS meeting and special events rally exhibition in various villages of perambalur and created mass awareness on TB. HIV AIDS awareness created through mass rally seminars Exhibition and staging cultural shows. More than fifty three general medical and eye camp organised for general public especially women and children. DAWN trust is organising Periodical School Health programme and Village sanitation programme. DAWN trust is donating minimum twenty units of blood every year to Government general Hospital and other voluntary organisation. Education and Literacy. Under the assistance of Sarva Siksha Abhiyan Alternative Innovative Education scheme DAWN Trust had provided non formal education to one hundred and thirty seven children in Alathur Block of Perambalur District and they were made to re enter into institutions of formal education. DAWN has organised Special Residential Bridge Course at Yasanai Village of Perambalur District for the benefit of twenty five mentally retarded children at the age group between six years and fourteen years under the SSA. Special teachers spend time with the children adapting their training methods to their varying degrees of mental retardation. The life skills training is provided to equip the mentally retarded students to look after themselves and maintain personal hygiene and cleanliness. Periodical awareness camps organised for the welfare of youth regarding teenage issues.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Dr. M.G.R. Educational and Research Institute, University has been keen in ensuring that the best talent are nurtured as Job Creators and not job seekers. With more than 30 years of experience in education, this University has made higher learning in the fields of Engineering and Technology, Dentistry, Medicine, Nursing, Physiotherapy and Humanities and Sciences. a gratifying experience. The campuses are on par with global standards - world class facilities with an eco friendly infrastructure and create the perfect ambience. The constituent colleges, Dr. M.G.R. Engineering College, and Thai Moogambigai Dental College and Hospital were founded in 1988 and 1991 respectively were upgraded to a Deemed University status in the name and style of Dr. M.G.R. Educational and Research Institute, University in 2003. A.C.S.Medical College and Hospital, offering MBBS course, has been brought as a constituent institution in 2013. The courses of the University are approved by respective statutory bodies like AICTE, DCI, MCI, INC, NCTE, etc., and accredited by NAAC. The University has been honoured with ISO 9001 2008 Certificate by TUV SUD, Germany. The faculty are highly competent with Doctoral qualifications and have several achievements to their credit. The University offers variety of courses in UG, PG and M.S./ Ph.D. All the courses are geared towards industry professionals to get hands on experience which will help the students to become Job Creators. Also the post-graduation courses in Thai Moogambigai Dental College and Hospital involve scientific research study colloboration and consultancy in various fields of Dental Surgery. The students receive support from the University in the form of campus placements, mini projects, industrial visits and career guidance. Training facilities such as the IBM Software Centre of Excellence, Oracle Workforce Development Program, Microsoft, National Instruments Lab, etc., were established to create industry ready professionals.The University makes sure that the course curriculum is constantly updated to the current standards. When the University provides such a vibrant atmosphere to young creative minds, it is bound to result in the students excelling and achieving top honours.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: DREAMS TRUST has been promoted 1500 poor self groups to alleviate rural and urban poverty with the total membership of 18,000. It has been awarded as a best NGO in the district recognised by Government of Tamil Nadu in the year 2007. Self employment vocational skill trainings were conducted for well over 1500 poor women members from poverty stricken families. We have promoted 17 Panchayat level Federations for their self development. 15000 tree saplings were planted by the organisation. We run community college and ITI and extending job oriented skill trainings to the rural and urban youth.
